text: Tour campus, meet our faculty, explore degree programs, and discover how you'll make your impact with a degree from Northern Vermont University.
Our curriculum starts year one, day one, with internships, site visits, exercises, travel, and collaborative research so you are prepared to hit the ground running.
Find your direction. Apply to Northern Vermont University today.
Explore our campus locations in Northern Vermont or our flexible, affordable online degree programs.
Vermont's premier public liberal arts campus prepares graduates for rewarding careers in an ever-changing world.
In the heart of Vermont's Northeast Kingdom, NVU-Lyndon offers professional programs with a liberal arts foundation.
Our online degree programs offer a flexible, affordable way to take your next step toward achieving your educational and professional goals.

Look North and you'll see our story. The story of how two strong colleges whose long histories of educating thinkers and leaders who have shaped Vermont, New England, and beyond, have come together to create something truly new. Discover how you'll make your impact felt far and wide with a degree from Northern Vermont University.

Find your direction and follow it. Do North.

At Northern Vermont University, North is more than just where we are. It's who we are. It's what we do. Our friendly admissions and aid staff members at our Johnson and Lyndon campuses are here to help you determine your next steps on your path to becoming a college student and to help you discover how you'll make your impact with a degree from NVU. Feel free to email us any time with questions at
You can also contact us directly at our campus offices.

NVU accepts applications via our own secure, web-based form. You will apply to either Johnson campus or our Lyndon campus.
You can pay your $50 application fee online or via check made payable to Northern Vermont University.
Submit your official transcript(s) to the campus at which you intend to enroll.
NVU does not require test scores. If you choose to submit your scores, use
Choose one of three topics to write about, to help us get to know you better.
If you are applying as a music, musical theater, or music education major, please submit an audio-visual audition.
Learn more about audition guidelines here.
Northern Vermont University offers a full-tuition scholarship for Vermont students who are enrolled full-time (12 credits or more) and have demonstrated high academic achievement.

Curious. Motivated. Capable. Your GPA shows that you are the kind of student who will thrive at Northern Vermont University. The NVU Futures Scholarship awards financial support to students based on their GPA and is renewable annually, for up to four years, to students with a 2.5 GPA or higher. If you have a proficiency-based transcript, contact the Admissions Office at the campus where you seek to enroll for more information.
*Vermont commuter students are eligible for a scholarship of up to $2,000.

Hard work and academic excellence earned you the highest honors in your high school. Now you can climb to new heights at NVU with a full-tuition scholarship. Vermonters who rank first or second in their high school class are eligible for free tuition to Northern Vermont University. These scholarship awards are renewable annually, for up to four years, for students who achieve a 3.0 GPA or higher.
Valedictorian and Salutatorian scholarships may not be combined with any other program or discount.
Determination of Valedictorian/Salutatorian will be based on the graduating school's standard practice and receipt of spring semester grades consistent with historical academic performance.
Northern Vermont University offers scholarship support for out-of-state students who are enrolled full-time (12 credits or more) and have demonstrated high academic achievement.

Curious. Motivated. Capable. Your GPA shows that you are the kind of student who will thrive at Northern Vermont University. The NVU Futures Scholarship and Futures Achievement Scholarship award financial support based on your GPA and are renewable annually for up to four years. This scholarship is available to out-of-state (non-Regional/Good Neighbor Program) students who are enrolled full-time (12 credits).

These awards are renewable annually, for up to four years, and are based on GPA ranking. If you have a proficiency-based transcript, please contact the Admissions Office at the campus where you seek to enroll.
*The Futures Achievement Scholarship is for out-of-state students who are not part of the NEBHE program and who do not qualify for regional discounts.
Good Neighbor Award and Regional (NEBHE) Awards

Northern Vermont University participates in two programs that offer a reduced tuition rate to eligible out-of-state students: the Good Neighbor Award (GN) and the Regional/NEBHE Award. Students can only receive
Learn more about eligible locations and majors here.
on the out-of-state tuition rate. This award is not dependent on GPA.
on the out-of-state tuition rate. This award is not dependent on GPA.
Combine awards and save up to $11,250.

For students who demonstrate high academic achievement, our Regional/Good Neighbor award can also be combined with our NVU Futures merit scholarship, detailed above. Total amount for the combined award is based on your GPA.
* Good Neighbor/NEBHE award is not dependent on GPA.

Hard work and academic excellence earned you the highest honors in your high school. Now you can climb to new heights at Northern Vermont University with special scholarships for out-of-state students who rank first or second in their high school class. These awards are renewable annually for up to four years.
Valedictorian and Salutatorian scholarships may not be combined with any other scholarships or family discount.
Out-of-state Valedictorians and Salutatorians receiving Good Neighbor or Regional (NEBHE) Awards will receive one half of the Valedictorian or Salutatorian scholarship amount.

North is opportunity. Hard work. Commitment. It's also an investment.

At Northern Vermont University, we understand that college is a significant expense for families. But if you want to make an impact on your future, you'll need to make an investment now. We're here to help guide you through the process of paying for college. Our student financial services experts on both campuses can answer your questions and help you navigate the path to paying for your college degree.

NVU offers scholarships for full-time students enrolling for the first time or transferring. Vermont residents, who already benefit from our affordable in-state tuition, can reduce the cost of attendance with merit scholarships that reward academic achievement. Out-of-state students residing in our Good Neighbor and Regional Student Program/NEBHE areas can combine those tuition discounts with merit scholarships. Find out details about merit scholarships and regional and family tuition discounts for Vermonters and out-of-state students here.

We're here to help. Student Administrative Services can assist with questions related to billing, aid, and registration. Both campus offices are open Monday-Friday, 8:30 a.m. - 4 p.m.

For most applicants, NVU accepts applications on a rolling basis (that is, applications are reviewed as they are received, and admitted students can enroll in the next semester). NVU is also a test-optional institution.
